comments:
Build ID: I20070517-1700

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Download Eclipse SDK 3.3RC1 (eclipse-SDK-3.3RC1-win32.zip) and unzip in a directory. Start Eclipse.

2. Use the Update Manager to install:
Europa Discovery Site / Models and Model Development / XML Schema Infoset Model (XSD) Extender SDK 2.3.0.v200705110650 (select required and install).

3. After downloading and installing, restart the IDE.

4. Try to open an XSD file: File / Open File...

You get an error message: "Error opening the editor. Reason: Invalid Input: Must be IFileEditorInput."


More information:
Because of this problem, the XSD editor cannot be used on Eclipse 3.3RC1.

The XSD I'm trying to open can be found at: http://www.khronos.org/files/collada_schema_1_4

(I saved that file with the extension .xsd on my harddrive and I'm opening that file).

Here is a stacktrace that appears when I click the Details button in the editor:

The XSD Editor predates Eclipse's ability (new feature) to open files directly from the file system, so adding support for that is an enhancement.

Created an attachment (id=68453)
A patch to provide the support

It needs some more testing...  I'm also looking into changing the generated EMF editor to support IURIEditorInput, which is new to Eclipse 3.3 since this provides access to an absolute URI which is exactly what EMF needs to be able to open such resources.

The changes were committed under a different bugzilla.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 189480 ***
